intro: Wahlenbergia okavangensis, commonly known as the Okavango lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and is adapted to seasonal flooding. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are upright and often branched. Wahlenbergia okavangensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
